alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Jackson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 26 at 4:28PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern St. Bernard Parish, Harrison and northwestern Jackson Counties through 530 PM CST... At 428 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pine Ridge to 6 miles west of Saucier to 19 miles south of Waveland to 15 miles east of Port Fourchon. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gulfport, Biloxi, Long Beach, D`iberville, Saucier, Lyman, Latimer and Gulfport Airport. This includes Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 21 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
